curam.util.cache

Interface CacheLoader<K,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - the cache key
    V - the cached value
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CacheLoaderAdapter

    public interface CacheLoader<K,V>
    A cache loader is responsible to load objects when they are not found in the cache.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose()
      Invoked only once when the cache loader is no longer needed.
      void init()
      Invoked only once before the cache loader is first needed.
      V load(K key)
      Loads an object for key key.
      java.util.Map<K,V> loadAll(java.util.Set<K> keys)
      Loads all objects with keys in keys.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
        Invoked only once before the cache loader is first needed.

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Invoked only once when the cache loader is no longer needed.

      • load

        V load(K key)
throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads an object for key key.
        Parameters:
        key - the object's key
        Returns:
        the loaded object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurred during the load operation

      • loadAll

        java.util.Map<K,V> loadAll(java.util.Set<K> keys)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads all objects with keys in keys.
        Parameters:
        keys - the key set. This parameter could be null meaning that the loader should populate the cache with all available objects. A implementation can choose to do nothing in this case if it does not support this behaviour.
        Returns:
        all objects for keys in keys
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurred during the load operation
